template&lt; class CharT &gt;
struct formatter&lt;std::thread::id, CharT&gt;;
}}

The template specialization of {{lc|std::formatter}} for the {{lc|std::thread::id}} class allows users to convert a thread identifier to its textual representation using [[cpp/utility/format|formatting functions]].

===Format specification===
The syntax of format specifications is:

{{sdsc begin}}
{{sdsc|{{spar optional|fill-and-align}} {{spar optional|width}}}}
{{sdsc end}}

{{spar|fill-and-align}} and {{spar|width}} have the same meaning as in [[cpp/utility/format/formatter#Standard format specification|standard format specification]]. The default alignment is {{ttb|&gt;}}.

The formatted output matches the output of {{rlpt|operator_ltlt|operator&lt;&lt;}}, adjusted as appropriate for the format specifiers.

===Notes===
{{feature test macro|__cpp_lib_formatters|Formatting {{tt|std::thread::id}} and {{lc|std::stacktrace}}|value=202302L|std=C++23}}

===Example===
{{example
|code=
#include &lt;format&gt;
#include &lt;iostream&gt;
#include &lt;thread&gt;

int main()
{
    std::thread::id this_id = std::this_thread::get_id();
    std::thread::id null_id;

    std::cout &lt;&lt; std::format("current thread id: {}\n", this_id);
    std::cout &lt;&lt; std::format("{:=^10}\n", null_id);
}
|p=true
|output=
current thread id: 140046396632256
====0=====
}}
